title: Curry, Podziemski overwhelm Lakers in Warriors' win
content: With playoff positioning on the line, the Lakers and Warriors squared off in a Western Conference showdown.

title: Morant uses finger-gun gesture despite warning
content: Grizzlies guard Ja Morant risked further action from the NBA after mimicking shooting a gun with his finger during Thursday night's 110-108 win at the Heat.

title: Sources: PGA Tour rejects PIF's recent $1.5B offer
content: The PGA Tour has rejected PIF's most recent offer to invest $1.5 billion into PGA Tour Enterprises, the tour's for-profit entity, which came with the caveat that the rival LIV Golf League would remain intact, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: LSU star Johnson to skip WNBA draft, source says
content: LSU star guard Flau'Jae Johnson is opting to skip the 2025 WNBA draft and will return to college basketball for her senior season, a source told ESPN on Thursday.

title: NHL's top goal scorer Draisaitl exits after injury
content: NHL leading goal scorer Leon Draisaitl left Thursday's game against the Sharks with an undisclosed injury, but the Oilers won to stay within two points of the Kings in the race for second place in the Pacific Division.

title: Man who conned ex-NBA star Howard gets 12 yrs.
content: A 50-year-old Georgia businessman was sentenced to more than 12 years in federal prison for scamming former NBA players Dwight Howard and Chandler Parsons out of millions of dollars.

title: Luka takes blame for 'unacceptable' night in loss
content: Luka Doncic was short and to the point in describing his cold shooting in the Lakers' 123-116 loss the Warriors on Thursday, calling it an "unacceptable" performance.

title: Giannis' NBA 1st of 35-17-20 keys Bucks' victory
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo became the first player in NBA history to have 35 points, 17 rebounds and a career-high 20 assists as the Bucks beat the 76ers 126-113 Thursday night.

title: How Nikola Jokic quietly became a defensive analytics darling
content: From kicked ball violations to memorizing plays, Jokic has become one of the league's best defenders.

title: Dawn Staley's road to Tampa begins in Philadelphia
content: No matter where she's called home, the Final Four coach's story is held close by those who watched her rise.

title: Women's Final Four predictions: Surrounded by 1-seeds, is No. 2 seed UConn the favorite?
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to Tampa. But 2-seed UConn has momentum and experience.

title: Are torpedo bats legal? Here's how they work and facts to know
content: A new baseball bat is all the rage right now. It's time to get up to speed on the MLB season's newest craze.

title: Duke's baton now fully passed from Coach K to Jon Scheyer
content: Mike Krzyzewski's emergence from the shadows is the ultimate sign that the baton in Durham has been passed.

title: Johni Broome could be 'the most impactful transfer in college basketball history'
content: The SEC Player of the Year is chasing history -- for himself and Auburn -- as the Tigers head into Final Four.

title: Playoff watch: Last stand for the Red Wings?
content: It's close to do-or-die time for Dylan Larkin & Co. Plus, updated playoff bracket, draft lottery projections.

title: Tatum? Pippen? NBA execs share best comps for projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg
content: Ahead of the Final Four, NBA execs share their comparisons for the Duke star and projected No. 1 draft pick.

title: Brooklyn to Indiana: Darryn Peterson's 48-hour run
content: After shining in the McDonald's All American Game, the Kansas commit inspired a Chipotle Nationals win.

title: Spurs' Ange: Cupped ear 'mistake' caused VAR
content: Tottenham's Ange Postecoglou has said he will likely watch less football once he finishes his coaching career as he continues to admonish VAR.

title: Milan's Walker open to Man City return in summer
content: Kyle Walker has left the door open to a return to Manchester City in the summer, saying "the chapter is not full closed."

title: Canales hurts foot kicking dressing room glass door
content: Monterrey midfielder Sergio Canales is doubtful for Saturday's Liga MX game against Guadalajara because of leg injuries suffered after breaking a glass door.

title: Fenerbahce: Mourinho provoked before nose grab
content: Fenerbahce have come out in defence of their coach Jose Mourinho, claiming he was provoked by his Galatasaray counterpart Okan Buruk following Wednesday's Turkish Cup game between the sides.

title: Postecoglou on VAR: Might as well let AI be ref
content: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou bemoaned the time-consuming VAR process that saw Pape Sarr's goal chopped off in their 1-0 defeat at Chelsea on Thursday.

title: Maresca: My mistake nearly cost Chelsea win
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca said he could have blown his side's chances of hanging on for a 1-0 win over Tottenham Hotspur on Thursday.

title: FIFA rankings: USMNT static, Canada at new high
content: The USMNT remained at 16th in the latest FIFA rankings released Thursday, while Canada climbed to a new all-time high and Mexico moved up two spots following last month's Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Life after OMG: Can 2025 Mets replicate their 2024 vibes?
content: After signing a superstar but losing a pop star, the Mets aim to make Citi Field twist again like it did last summer.

title: First impressions from the Athletics' new home opener
content: How the players, fans and staff handled the first of many games in their minor league stadium residency.

title: 'The most unique quarterback story I've ever heard': How Luis Perez became 'The Spring King'
content: UFL QB Luis Perez has chronicled his unique journey in a book as he pushes for a final chapter in the NFL.

title: How UCLA's Gabriela Jaquez shifted focus during Final Four run
content: Gabriela Jaquez is chasing history with UCLA after spending her summer doing the same with Team Mexico.

title: Safety? Aesthetics? Competitive advantage? The real reasons some teams want to ban the tush push
content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: Far from the March Madness spotlight, college hoops grapples with a gambling problem
content: All eyes are on the Final Four, but college athletics officials are worried about suspicious bets on games featuring smaller schools.

title: Florida center Olivier Rioux enjoys Final Four experience from record-breaking vantage point
content: The Florida Gators' redshirt freshman is the world's tallest teenager, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Why the Manchester derby lost its cachet, and how it might be coming back around
content: Sunday's Manchester derby will be the lowest-key edition in some time. How did we get here, and when might it get back to the thrilling matchup it once was?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United make Italy striker Lucca new target
content: Udinese and Italy striker Lorenzo Lucca has emerged as a leading summer target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: De Bruyne to leave Man City at end of season
content: Kevin De Bruyne has announced that he will leave the club at the end of the season . the england international's contract at the Etihad Stadium expires in the summer . he has won 16 premier league titles, five Carabao Cups, two FA Cups and a Champions League .

title: Ranking the 15 best players: From Bueckers and Betts to Paopao and Strong
content: the top 15 players in women's college basketball will compete in the final four . "nBA Today" has ranked the top players in men's basketball throughout the season . it's time to see the very best on the biggest stage . the WNBA draft pick is in her fourth final Four .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Jets take over the top spot, plus every team's performance vs. projections
content: the blues beat the Penguins for their 11th win in a row . there are less than two weeks left in the 2024-25 NHL regular season . the playoff field continues to be whittled down, with teams clinching berths .

title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
content: "the Pat McAfee Show" is a showdown of the top two teams from the best conference in men's college basketball . our experts are here to break down how each team can win its final Four matchup . read their analysis for Florida vs. Auburn .

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: Power Rankings: Who are the top teams one week into the season?
content: the Dodgers and Padres are undefeated, while a team with lofty expectations in the Braves are winless to start the season . we've seen both great individual performances -- Aaron Judge ' walk-off three-run blast' and not so great ones -- Rafael Devers' historic strikeout streak .

title: Crisis in JD(U)? 5 leaders quit Nitish Kumar's party as Parliament passes Waqf Bill
content: Not one or two but at least five leaders submitted their resignations as the bill was passed, first in Lok Sabha and then the Rajya Sabha on Thursday and Friday, respectively.  ​The latest to resign from the party was Nadeem Akhtar, his resignation follows that of four other leaders, including JD(U) leader Raju Nayyar, Tabrez Siddiqui Alig, Mohammad Shahnawaz Malik, and Mohammed Kasim Ansari.

title: Protests & petitions: Multipronged oppn erupts against Waqf Bill
content: The Waqf Amendment Bill 2025 sparked large-scale protests across India, including Ahmedabad, Kolkata, and Chennai, after it cleared Parliament. Leaders of AIMIM and Congress challenged its constitutionality in the Supreme Court. The Opposition and several leaders criticized the Bill's passage and its potential impact on religious rights.

title: MS Dhoni to return as Chennai Super Kings captain?
content: CSK's batting coach Michael Hussey hints at a leadership change for their IPL match against Delhi Capitals, opening the possibility of MS Dhoni returning as captain if Ruturaj Gaikwad is unable to play due to injury. With Gaikwad's participation uncertain, there is speculation that a young wicketkeeper might also fill in.

title: 'We've food apps, China has ... ': Piyush Goyal's startup reality check
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the disparity between Indian and Chinese startups, emphasizing that while Indian startups focus on food delivery and fantasy sports apps, Chinese startups concentrate on advanced technologies like EVs, AI, and semiconductors. He called for more domestic investment and innovation in the Indian startup ecosystem.

title: Are Trump's reciprocal tariffs bad for China? DeepSeek says...
content: US President Donald Trump's new 54% tariffs on Chinese imports could disrupt sectors, notably technology. China’s export ban on key minerals impacts US manufacturing. AI leader DeepSeek suggests China can counter with a mix of tariffs, export controls, tighter inspections, currency adjustments, trade diversification, legal challenges, and boosting domestic consumption to mitigate the impact.

title: Video of Rahane punishing Jaiswal for 'discipline issues' goes viral
content: Ajinkya Rahane disciplined Yashasvi Jaiswal during the 2022 Duleep Trophy final, sending him off the field for aggressive sledging. The resurfaced video coincides with Jaiswal’s switch from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025–26 season. Jaiswal’s move is seen as a major boost for Goa, highlighting his fiery ambition and Rahane’s influence on his discipline.

title: USCIS' message to H1-B, Green Card visa applicants: There are only two...
content: USCIS has revised its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, male and female, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. Effective April 2, this change applies to all immigration benefit requests. The determination of sex will be based on birth certificates, and discrepancies may lead to processing delays.

title: 'Dark chapter in federalism': Stalin slams Centre after anti-NEET Bill rejected
content: Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister MK Stalin declared the Centre's rejection of the state's Bill seeking NEET exemption a 'dark chapter in federalism.' The Bill, which aimed to base medical admissions on Class 12 marks, was rejected despite the state's clarifications. An all-party meeting is planned to decide the next steps.

title: Deposit PPF money by April 5 to get this big benefit
content: To maximize benefits from PPF investments, ensure deposits are made by April 5 each year, as interest calculation is based on the minimum balance between the 5th and month's end. A timely deposit enhances returns, with tardy contributions resulting in interest loss.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Huge Protests In Kolkata, Chennai After Waqf Bill Clears Parliament
content: Thousands of protesters gathered on the streets of Kolkata, Chennai, and Ahmedabad Friday afternoon - after weekly prayers by the Muslim community - to protest the Waqf Amendment Bill passed by Parliament this week.

title: K Annamalai To Step Down As Tamil Nadu BJP Chief? He Says...
content: Adding fuel to speculation that he may be replaced as the president of the Tamil Nadu BJP, K Annamalai has said that he is not in the running to be the next state chief of the party.

title: Indian Startup Bosses On Piyush Goyal's "Dukandaari Hi Karna Hain?" Question
content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's note to Indian startups - asking them to shift focus from food delivery to more advanced technological solutions - has led to a debate online.

title: "Any Rhetoric...": PM's Message To Bangladesh Leader After Northeast Remark
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Muhammad Yunus, chief advisor of Bangladesh's interim government, are meeting on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC Summit in Bangkok

title: "Vultures...": Congress MLA Caught In Bengaluru Suicide Row Slams BJP
content: Karnataka Congress MLA AS Ponnanna - under fire from the BJP after the death by suicide of functionary Vinay Somaia - has said he never met him and called the BJP "vultures politicising deaths".

title: "Don't Push Us To Wall": Omar Abdullah's Party To Centre Amid Transfer Row
content: The Omar Abdullah-led National Conference today passed two resolutions, one urging the Centre to respect the people's mandate in Jammu and Kashmir and another condemning the passage of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in Parliament.

title: "Everything Will Be Finished": Sacked Teachers Target Bengal Government
content: The Supreme Court judgment cancelling the appointment of more than 25,000 teachers and other school staff in West Bengal has sparked a massive political row, with the ruling Trinamool Congress and the Opposition BJP and CPM trading barbs.

title: "Extremely Dangerous": Harvard Professor's Early Warning On US Stock Turmoil
content: US stock futures fell sharply today, signalling more losses on Wall Street, after China retaliated with fresh tariffs a day after the Trump administration's sweeping levies knocked off $2.4 trillion from US equities.

title: Billionaires Lost $208 Billion After Tariff Announcement, Biggest Loser Is...
content: The drop is the fourth-largest one-day decline in the Billionaires Index's 13-year history, and the largest since the peak of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: UK Comedian-Actor Russell Brand Charged With Rape: London Police
content: London's Metropolitan Police on Friday said it had charged comedian and actor Russell Brand with rape and a number of other sexual offences.

title: IPL LIVE: MI Look To Break IPL Jinx vs LSG; Pressure On Rohit And Pant
content: Lucknow Super Giants vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025: LSG captain Rishabh Pant and MI star Rohit Sharma have been in dreadful form so far this season.

title: China Responds To US With 34% Retaliatory Tariff As Trade War Escalates
content: China said on Friday it would slap 34 percent tariffs on all imports of US goods from April 10 after Washington imposed steep new levies on Chinese products.

title: Kavalam-Thattassery bridge in Kuttanad gets KIIFB nod
content: Bridge will connect Alappuzha-Changanassery road and Main Central road and help reduce distance between Alappuzha and Kottayam by around 9 km

title: Resolve land-related grievances in a time-bound manner, Revenue officials told
content: Tribal farmers are happy with the holding of revenue sadassulu in their villages, says Parvatipuram-Manyam Collector

title: Dry Bihar recorded 190 confirmed hooch deaths in last 9 years: Official
content: The districts which reported the maximum number of confirmed hooch deaths were Saran, Siwan, Gaya, Bhojpur, Buxar and Gopalganj

title: Chittoor MP hails the role of SHGs in women’s empowerment
content: The objective of SHGs is to transform women into queens of their households and contributors to society, besides showcasing Indian culture and traditions globally, says Daggumalla Prasada Rao

title: CPI(M) Party Congress passes resolution calling for democratic people to defend LDF govt. in Kerala
content: ‘’The Left government in Kerala has provided an alternative to the neo-liberal policies of the Union government while being opposed to the Hindutva ideology and upholding secularism’‘

title: Former chief of BIRRD receives honour from Mauritian Prime Minister
content: Navinchandra Ramgoolam confers the title ‘Vishva Vaidya Divyang Bandhu’ on Dr. Jagadish in recognition of his contributions to the welfare of the differently-abled

title: T.N. Governor Ravi, CM Stalin to take part in inauguration of new Pamban rail bridge
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will also lay the foundation stone for the four-laning of the Walajahpet/Ranipet section of NH 40 along the Tamil Nadu-Andhra Pradesh border

title: PM Modi leaves Thailand for three-day Sri Lanka visit
content: Modi last travelled to Sri Lanka in 2019. It will be his fourth visit to the island nation since 2015

title: 'Avoid rhetoric that vitiates environment': PM Modi tells Yunus
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Muhammad Yunus, chief adviser of Bangladesh's interim government, at the Bimstec Summit in Bangkok. Modi raised concerns over minority safety in Bangladesh and urged a thorough investigation of related incidents. He highlighted the significance of regional peace and constructive bilateral relations.

title: 'Main gangster hota': Pak cricketer's comment leaves everyone in splits
content: Pakistan spinner Sajid Khan humorously remarked he would have been a gangster if not a cricketer. In an interview, he made the tongue-in-cheek comment, bringing laughter. Sajid, known for his off-spin, praised Babar Azam and Virat Kohli while showcasing his wit and lighter side, continuing to entertain both on and off the field.

title: 'Not in race for TN BJP chief post': Annamalai sparks resignation rumours
content: Tamil Nadu BJP president K Annamalai stated on Friday that the party's leader would be chosen unanimously, and clarified that he is not a contender. This announcement follows speculation about a potential BJP-AIADMK alliance aimed at challenging the ruling DMK in the 2026 elections.

title: PSEB class 8 result out: Direct link, pass percentage and other details
content: The PSEB Class 8 Result 2025 was announced on April 4, 2025. Students can check their results on pseb.ac.in. To access their mark sheets, they must enter their roll number and name. Original mark sheets will be distributed through schools. Exams took place from February 19 to March 7, 2025, with about 3 lakh students participating.

title: Antibiotic-resistant superbug spreading in Malaysia- A global threat?
content: A dangerous superbug resistant to antibiotics has been spreading in Malaysia. The bug, Acinetobacter baumannii, causes severe infections, particularly in hospitals. Researchers are concerned about its global impact due to its prevalence and resistance to multiple drugs. Continuous surveillance and improved treatments are urgently needed to combat this health threat.

title: A 'squeaky' feat: Rat breaks world record for detecting landmines
content: A rat named Ronin has set a new record by detecting over 100 landmines in Cambodia since August 2021, surpassing the previous record held by Magawa. Trained by Belgian organization APOPO, Ronin is part of the HeroRAT initiative. Cambodia remains heavily mined due to past conflicts, and Ronin's achievements highlight the importance of animal-assisted demining efforts.

title: 'Rohit Sharma has earned the right not to be pressurised'
content: Mumbai Indians batting coach Kieron Pollard has backed Rohit Sharma, urging patience despite his slow start in IPL 2025. Pollard highlighted Rohit's legendary status and recent Champions Trophy success, encouraging fans to give him space. With important matches ahead, all eyes are on Rohit to reclaim his form and lead Mumbai Indians to success.

title: 'Rishabh Pant is yet to ... ': Sanjiv Goenka's huge take on LSG skipper
content: Following LSG's eight-wicket loss to PBKS in the 2025 IPL, owner Sanjiv Goenka expressed strong faith in skipper Rishabh Pant's leadership. He emphasised Pant's instinct-driven style and potential for growth. Despite a tough game, Goenka encouraged the team to believe in themselves for future matches. LSG aims to bounce back against Mumbai Indians.

title: Saquon Barkley surprises Trump’s daughter Ivanka & grandson with signed football
content: Saquon Barkley, Philadelphia Eagles running back, gave a signed football to Ivanka Trump's son at the J.P. Morgan Tech 100 Summit. This act garnered mixed reactions online. Despite the social media speculation, Barkley has maintained focus on football. He aims to continue shining on the field, coming off a historic season where he surpassed 2,000 rushing yards.

title: 'Let's enjoy last moments together!': De Bruyne confirms Man City exit
content: Manchester City’s Kevin De Bruyne announced he will leave at the end of this season, ending his 10-year tenure. The 33-year-old, who joined in 2015, has won 14 major trophies, including six Premier League titles and the 2023 UEFA Champions League. De Bruyne expressed gratitude and cherished the memories with the club.

title: Incidents of temples being defaced on rise in US: MEA
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has expressed serious concerns over the increasing incidents of anti-India graffiti defacing Hindu temples in the US. Diplomatic channels are actively addressing these hate crimes, with US authorities investigating and treating them as severe offenses. Members of US Congress have also advocated for broader strategies to counteract these hate crimes against Hindus.

title: 'No rocket science': Ashish Nehra reveals his coaching philosophy at GT
content: Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra stresses the importance of stability and simplicity in coaching. He aims to create a relaxed environment for players. Nehra supports captain Shubman Gill and believes in his potential to lead the team. He highlights the need for chemistry in frequently changing squads, focusing on the basics and personal growth.

title: "Insta Queen" Punjab Cop Sacked After She Was Caught With 17 Grams Heroin
content: Senior woman constable Amandeep Kaur was arrested amid the Punjab government's ongoing anti-drug drive, 'Yudh Nasheyan Virudh.'

title: Bengaluru Man Dies By Suicide, Blames Congress For Death In Suicide Note
content: A 35-year-old man was found dead by suicide in his office in Bengaluru's Nagawara area on Friday. In a letter, he alleged that a politically motivated FIR, orchestrated by a local Congress leader, forced him to die by suicide.

title: Nuclear Powered Rockets May Make Trip To Mars Faster, More Efficient: Report
content: A revolution in spaceflight is in the offing. British startup Pulsar Fusion has unveiled its nuclear fusion-powered rocket, the Sunbird, CNN reported.

title: Waqf Bill BJP’s ploy to divide country, say protesters in Kolkata
content: BJP passed the bill in both Houses due to their majority. This is not just an attempt to seize Muslim properties but also malign us, one of the protesters said

title: Rahul Gandhi calls for national law ensuring budget share for Dalit and Adivasi welfare
content: He emphasized the need for concrete steps to ensure that Dalits and Adivasis have meaningful representation and a voice in governance

title: Congress MP moves SC against Waqf Bill hours after Parliament clears it
content: Congress MP Mohammed Jawed said the provisions of the law imposed “arbitrary restrictions” on waqf properties and their management, thereby undermining the “religious autonomy of the Muslim community”

title: NREGA a major contributor to rural employment, says Chittoor Collector
content: The Collector highlighted that the scheme had changed the landscape of the rural employment and contributed a lot to the infrastructure development across the district

title: 16,343 malnourished children in Mumbai suburb: Survey
content: Guardian Minister Ashish Shelar has instructed officials to devise a plan in 10 days to address malnutrition among children in Mumbai’s suburbs

title: ED conducts searches at L2: Empuraan producer Gokulam Gopalan’s premises in Chennai
content: The searches were conducted at the chit fund office of Gokulam Gopalan in Kodambakkam as well as his residence at Neelangarai

title: Jaguar jet crash: Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav cremated with full military honours
content: A large number of people, including several ex-servicemen carrying the tricolour in their hands, stood on roads showering flower petals as the vehicle carrying the IAF officer’s mortal remains passed through

title: Parliamentary proceedings | 682 Indians deported from U.S. since January, majority had attempted to enter illegally, says MEA
content: Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh informed about steps taken by India to support its citizens facing deportation or other legal consequences due to their undocumented status in the U.S.

title: SC directs CEC to survey Agasthyamalai landscape to spot encroachments into forests
content: The CEC survey would include the Periyar tiger reserve, Srivilliputhur grizzled squirrel wildlife sanctuary, Meghamalai and Thirunelveli wildlife sanctuaries

title: Krishna Janmabhoomi case: SC issues notice on mosque committee plea against clubbing suits
content: The mosque committee also filed a separate plea challenging another order of the Allahabad High Court by which it said the Union Ministry of Home Affairs and the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) were to be made parties to the pending lawsuits of Hindu side

title: Protests erupt in Kolkata, Ahmedabad after passage of Waqf Bill
content: In Kolkata and Ahmedabad, protesters rallied against the Waqf Amendment Bill after Friday prayers, blocking roads and voicing their opposition. The bill, passed in the Rajya Sabha, makes changes such as reducing mandatory contributions and introducing state auditors. It awaits the President's nod to become law. Supporters claim it improves transparency, while critics see it as impinging on religious autonomy.

title: Setback for Tamil Nadu as Centre declines consent for anti-NEET bill
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced that the Centre has rejected the state's Assembly resolution seeking NEET exemption. Despite submitting all necessary clarifications, the Union government declined the request. Stalin condemned the decision and scheduled an all-party meeting for April 9 to discuss future actions, describing it as a setback for federalism.

title: Punjabi songs, luxury bags and a Thar: How cop mocked own force in reels
content: Punjab police constable Amandeep Kaur was dismissed for violating professional norms by posting social media videos in uniform and was subsequently arrested for possessing heroin. The action came amid a state anti-drug campaign, with police finding 17.71 grams of heroin during a search of her vehicle.

title: Why Sensex has crashed over 900 points - top 4 reasons
content: Indian stock market indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, suffered significant declines on Friday, triggered by US recession fears and new tariffs announced by American President Donald Trump.

title: Woman says feeling 'so safe' in Delhi, appreciates cab driver's kind gesture
content: A heartwarming story from Delhi where a Rapido driver helped a woman in distress by offering support and ensuring her safety. She struggled to book a ride without a phone, but the driver stayed with her until she reached her accommodation safely. This act of kindness has inspired many on social media, highlighting the existence of good people.

title: Salman Khan starrer 'Sikandar' less likely to cross Rs 100 crore
content: Salman Khan's film 'Sikandar' had a lower-than-expected opening, earning Rs 26 crore on its first day. Despite releasing prior to Eid, it failed to show significant growth, collecting Rs 29 crore on Eid. By day 6, the film's total stood at Rs 90.66 crore.

title: 'Unfortunate': LS Speaker Birla slams Sonia over Waqf Bill 'bulldozed' remark
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla criticised Sonia Gandhi's comments on the Waqf Amendment Bill, calling them "unfortunate" and undermining parliamentary democracy. Despite extensive discussions and proper procedures, Birla noted her allegations were inappropriate. Sonia Gandhi claimed the bill undermined democratic values and was pushed through forcibly, sparking debate between the government and opposition.

title: ‘There will be blood’: Is the world staring at a recession?
content: Economic forecasts show growing recession fears as Donald Trump's new tariff announcements dampen global business sentiment and disrupt supply chains. Major financial institutions like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have significantly increased the likelihood of a recession, while the S&P 500 has experienced severe market losses.

title: Social media has a field day over Trump’s tariff on uninhabited island
content: In an unexpected move, President Trump imposed a 10% tariff on US trading partners, amusingly including the uninhabited Heard and McDonald Islands of Australia. This decision sparked online satire and drew a mixed reply from Australia, with the tariffs affecting other territories like Norfolk Island more severely.

title: Crops under threat as surprise March heatwave hit Central Asia: Study
content: A surprise heatwave hit Central Asia in March, a new study published Friday showed, putting in danger crops and water supply in a largely rural region already heavily affected by the impacts of climate change.  "Hotter March temperatures are impacting agriculture harvests and access to water in Central Asia, as well as people's health," said Friederike Otto, co-head of World Weather Attribution.

title: Trump admin revises reciprocal tariffs for 14 countries including India - Full list
content: US President Donald Trump’s announcement of reciprocal tariffs revealed discrepancies between the displayed charts and the White House annexure. The White House has now amended the annex to match the lower rates initially shown. The revised rates will impact numerous countries with differential tariffs being applied from April 5.

title: $2.4tn shock: How US stocks 'boomed' after Trump tariff surgery- 10 big numbers
content: Wall Street experienced its largest one-day loss since the start of Covid due to new US tariffs announced by President Trump. The S&P 500 lost $2.4 trillion in value, with significant declines in tech and retail sectors. Analysts predict increases in household costs and an escalating trade conflict.

title: BJP functionary found dead, blames Congress MLA in social media post
content: Vinay Somaiah, a 35-year-old BJP functionary, was found hanging in his office in Bengaluru. Before his death, Vinay had accused a Congress functionary of abetting his suicide following an arrest and FIR against him for comments made on a WhatsApp group.

title: India will help rebuild infra, cultural landmarks devastated by Myanmar quake: Indian envoy
content: India would engage closely with Myanmar to assess needs and discuss detailed plans, ensuring a comprehensive approach to rebuilding infrastructure and cultural landmarks, says India's Ambassador to Myanmar Abhay Thakur

title: Vibrant Villages Programme: Union Cabinet approves second phase with outlay of ₹6,839 crore
content: The Vibrant Villages Programme was launched in 2023 for comprehensive development of select villages near the International Border

title: AIADMK walks out of T.N. Assembly after Speaker denies permission to raise a ‘law and order’ issue
content: Addressing journalists outside the Assembly, Mr. Palaniswami referred to the March 24 incident, in which a group of persons had ransacked the house of YouTuber ‘Savukku’ Shankar

title: Cabinet approves additional railway lines for Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Odisha
content: The four projects, with a total outlay of ₹18,658 crore, are based on PM Gati Shakti plan to match demand and supply from cargo points

title: Aadhaar made mandatory for online real money games because of two-step verification: A-G to Madras HC
content: He tells a Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar that any other process would involve only a one-step verification

title: KIMS-Bollineni hospital woman intern breathes her last after eleven days of battle for life
content: On March 24, the victim had allegedly attempted to end her life, accusing KIMS-Bollineni Hospital Assistant General Manager Deepak of sexual assault and intimidation

title: Passage of Wakf Bill a historic step towards justice, transparency, accountability: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: Pawan Kalyan said the NDA has once again proved its commitment to resolving long-standing concerns about the Wakf Boards under the visionary leadership of PM Modi

title: No rain alerts to Telangana for next few days
content: Either 36°C to 40°C or 41°C to 44°C was forecast in all districts from Saturday to Tuesday (August 8, 2025)

title: Madras High Court quashes DVAC chargesheet against T.N. Minister I. Periyasamy
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan passes the order after taking note that the case against all the other accused had been quashed, and that he remained the sole accused

title: Noted Malayalam and Tamil actor Ravikumar passes away
content: Actor Ravikumar, known for his romantic hero roles in Malayalam and Tamil cinema, passed away at 71 in Chennai

title: SC refuses review of decision against confiscating funds received via electoral bonds
content: The top court's order, made available recently, also refused to accept Mr. Bhati's prayer for an open-court hearing in the matter

title: ED quizzes Empuraan producer Gokulam Gopalan in suspected foreign exchange violation case
content: Ahead of the interrogation, ED squad carried out extensive searches at his house at Vadakara and other regional offices in Kozhikode

title: Sacked for heroin possession, cop flaunted luxury cars on Instagram
content: Punjab Police constable Amandeep Kaur was arrested with 17.7 grams of heroin and subsequently dismissed from service for defying departmental orders. Kaur often flaunted her uniform and luxurious lifestyle on social media, violating policies intended to maintain professionalism within the force.

title: Who developed Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff formula? Mystery continues
content: US President Donald Trump has announced significant tariffs on trade partners to address trade imbalances. Conflicting accounts regarding the formula's origin add to the confusion, but it’s attributed to the Council of Economic Advisers and the US Trade Representative. The move raises concerns of a potential trade war.

title: Mass resignations rock CPI(M) in Kerala’s Alappuzha district
content: At least 56 party members, including four branch secretaries under Thumboli local committee, have reportedly resigned from CPI(M)

title: 50 Munambam residents join BJP in presence of Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Rajeev Chandrasekhar terms the development ‘a response to people’s representatives ignoring’ the agitation by Munambam residents

title: SC permits Jharkhand to cut power supply during Ram Navami processions to avoid electrocution
content: The Bench, however, asks the Jharkhand government to keep the power cuts to minimum level and confined to procession routes

title: CPI(M) conference adopts resolution to declare Israel as an ‘apartheid State’
content: Says the BJP-led government at the Centre should stop supporting Israel and revert to the established Indian policy of backing Palestine

title: Five-member technical panel certifies new Pamban rail bridge as ‘structurally safe’
content: The Railway Ministry formed the committee after the Commissioner of Railway Safety pointed out “glaring lapses” in the planning and execution of the sea bridge

title: From Dhanbad to Bengaluru, wells in 10 cities to get a fresh lease of life with shallow aquifers
content: The Shallow Aquifer Management programme aims to deliver a scientific understanding of groundwater management

title: President withholds assent to T.N.’s anti-NEET Bill; CM Stalin to hold all-party meeting on April 9
content: The Tamil Nadu Admission to Undergraduate Medical Degree Courses Bill was passed unanimously in the Assembly in September 2021. After the Bill was returned by the Governor, an all-party meeting was held in February 2022. The Bill was then re-adopted in the Assembly and sent for the President’s assent.

title: Wikipedia must remove India content deemed defamatory, rules Delhi High Court
content: The court will continue to hear the case, in which ANI seeks damages of about ₹2 crore and an apology from Wikimedia.

title: Pathar Pratima blast: Brother of prime accused arrested in Bengal
content: The arrested person is the brother of the prime accused, who is the owner of the firecracker manufacturing unit situated a few metres away from the house where the explosion took place

title: Yasin Malik trial: SC allows him to cross-examine witnesses through video conferencing from Tihar Jail
content: The order came on a plea filed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) seeking transfer of the trials in the 1989 case of the kidnapping of Rubaiya Sayeed, daughter of former union minister Mufti Mohammed Sayeed, and the 1990 Srinagar shootout case, from Jam

title: Quad grouping ‘coordinating efforts’ for relief to Myanmar after earthquake
content: The statement is significant for a grouping that was formed to deliver HADR assistance in the Indian Ocean Region in the aftermath of the 2004 tusnami

title: Lok Sabha adjourned sine die; Budget session concludes
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said as many as 16 Bills were passed during the session and the House productivity was pegged at over 118%

title: PM Modi to arrive in Sri Lanka on April 4 night
content: Visit to include bilateral talks at leadership and delegation levels, signing of key agreements, talks with opposition politicians; Spotlight on contentious fisheries issue, defence pact

title: West Bengal recruitment scam: Mamata Banerjee must resign, she will go to jail, says BJP
content: Union Minister and West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar claimed that Mamata Banerjee will be the second CM after Haryana's O.P. Chautala to go to jail in the recruitment of teachers

title: PM Modi offers linking UPI with payment systems of BIMSTEC nations
content: Prime Minister also proposed to set up a BIMSTEC Chamber of Commerce, organise annual business summits and explore promoting trade in local currencies within the region.

title: CPI(M) rallies behind Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in CMRL pay-off case; Congress demands his resignation
content: Prakash Karat says CPI(M) will fight the case, which he claims is aimed at Chief Minister’s family, legally and politically

title: Avoid rhetoric that vitiates constructive relationship, urges PM Modi during talks with Bangladesh’s Yunus
content: Bangladesh Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus has spoken about Sheikh Hasina, Ganges and Teesta Water Treaty among others, in the 40 minute meeting

title: Rare long-snouted vine snake rediscovered in Dudhwa Tiger Reserve
content: The discovery was made on March 28 during a rhino release operation in the Palia Kheri division, when a vibrant green snake emerged while officials were clearing a termite mound for safety

title: U.S. revises tariff on India downwards from 27% to 26%
content: US reduces import duties on India from 27% to 26% starting April 9, reciprocal tariffs announced for other countries.

title: Waqf Bill will benefit Munambam residents, says Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: ‘Please don’t try to create any confusion. Let’s wait and see how it pans out,’ says Suresh Gopi in response to queries about whether the amendments will have retrospective effect

title: India ranks tenth with $1.4 billion private investment in Artificial Intelligence: United Nations report
content: The 2025 Technology and Innovation Report, issued by UN Trade and Development (UNCTAD), also states that India ranked 36th in 2024 on the ‘Readiness for Frontier Technologies’ index, improving its position from 48th in 2022

title: ASI taking proactive measures to mitigate any damage to Aurangzeb’s tomb: Govt in Parliament
content: Archaeological Survey of India protects Aurangzeb’s tomb in Maharashtra with proactive measures against extremist threats.

title: Flight from London with Indian passengers diverted to Turkiye to resume Mumbai journey
content: fter receiving the necessary technical approvals, the flight will resume its onward journey to Mumbai from Diyarbakir Airport at 12:00 local time today, as per the Virgin Atlantic officials.

title: Madras High Court refuses to quash FIR against Periyar University Vice-Chancellor
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan dismisses a petition filed by him in January 2024 to quash the FIR registered under the SC/ST Act and the charge of cheating

title: It is expected Bangladesh will ‘thoroughly investigate’ minority-related incidents: India
content: Over 2,400 minority-related incidents in Bangladesh reported, India expects thorough investigation and justice for perpetrators.

title: SIT inspects North Sentinel Island for any article left behind by arrested U.S. national
content: Officials are using binoculars in a boat while maintaining a distance to locate any article that may have been left behind by Mykhailo Polyakov and could endanger the life and safety of the indigenous Sentinelese tribe.

title: Waqf Bill: No party whip, BJD asked MPs to vote by their conscience
content: Our party, having taken these views into careful consideration, has entrusted our members in the Rajya Sabha with the responsibility of exercising their conscience in the best interest of justice, harmony and the rights of all communities,  BJD Rajya Sabha member Sasmit Patra said.

title: Munambam land dispute in Kerala: A comprehensive coverage
content: A package on the contentious Munambam land issue. The occupants of the land have been protesting demanding that the revenue rights of their holdings be restored after Kerala State Waqf Board staked its claim to the property

title: Heavy rains lash Vijayawada, thundershowers expected in parts of Andhra Pradesh
content: Alluri Sitarama Raju, Kakinada, East Godavari, Anantapur, Annamayya, and Tirupati districts are likely to receive light to moderate rainfall accompanied by thundershowers.

title: Congress to challenge Waqf Bill soon in Supreme Court
content: Congress to challenge constitutionality of Wakf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 in Supreme Court, resisting Modi Govt’s assaults on Constitution.

title: PM Modi, Muhammad Yunus seated together at BIMSTEC dinner in Thailand
content: Mr. Yunus’ office shared photographs of the Bangladesh Chief Advisor seated next to Mr. Modi at Hotel Shangri-La on the banks of the Chao Phraya River

title: Samastha mouthpiece slams Priyanka Gandhi’s absence in Lok Sabha during discussion, voting on Waqf Bill
content: In an editorial, Suprabhatham says Priyanka Gandhi’s non-attendance from Lok Sabha violated Congress’ whip and that the question of why Rahul Gandhi did not speak against the divisive Bill will also ‘reverberate through eternity’

title: Fire breaks out at Andhra Pradesh Secretariat at Velagapudi
content: The extent of damage is yet to be ascertained. No staff members were inside the offices at the time of the outbreak

title: Ready to help, PM Modi tells Myanmar’s Senior General as his country recovers from earthquake
content: Prime Minister Modi meets Myanmar’s Senior General Min at BIMSTEC Summit to discuss earthquake relief efforts and regional connectivity.

title: It’s turtle time in coastal Karnataka
content: Hundreds of sea turtles, mainly Olive Ridleys, flock to Karnataka’s beaches to lay eggs during December-March, mainly in Uttara Kannada

title: Ranga Shankara to celebrate Ugadi with Kathaa Kaala
content: Every year, Ranga Shankara marks Ugadi with a special event called Ranga Yugadi, that celebrates the literary richness of Karnataka

title: Night squads against drug abuse urged not to take law into hands
content: Four residents’ associations at Thykoodam near Vyttila have joined hands to form night squads to combat drug menace; EDRAAC asks them not to encroach on the domain of law enforcement agencies or resort to physically assaulting suspects

title: A risky jab and HIV threat put Kerala’s Valanchery in alert mode
content: The news that 10 injecting drug users in a local body in Malappuram district have tested positive for Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) has come as a rude shock to the State. Abdul Latheef Naha tracks the risky behaviour of drug users to find out how the practice has put their lives in peril, besides upsetting the health plans of the State

title: NHRC issues notice to Assam Govt. over detention of journalist
content: Human rights body issues notice to Assam Director General of Police calling for a detailed report in the matter within four weeks

title: 'Jaiswal Kicked Rahane's Kitbag', Friction Between Stars Behind Goa Move
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal reveals that he is shifting to goa due to new opportunities . the 23-year-old will play for goa from the 2025-26 season . jaiswal says he will be indebted to the governing body .
